cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, expected to turn north tonight and north-northeast on Wednesday, paralleling the Florida west coast and then tracking inland across the north-Florida Gulf Coast before moving across GA/SC
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-Florida Gulf Coast near the Big Bend (between Egmont Key and Steinhatchee River)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Egmont Key to Steinhatchee River FL. Tropical Storm Watch: West of Ochlockonee River FL to South Santee River SC.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Florida Keys Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas and Florida west coast Flamingo to Ochlockonee River. Storm-surge warnings Bonita Beach to Aucilla River FL including Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, entire west coast of Florida, Florida Big Bend, then Atlantic coasts of GA/SC/NC into New England
weather_observation.wind: Occasional squalls with gusts 30–40 mph possible Tuesday; sustained tropical-storm-force winds unlikely (≤6% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge threat for the southeast Florida Atlantic coast; surge focus remains on the west coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could drop 2–4 inches with isolated higher totals, producing brief urban street flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Tuesday–Tuesday night as rainbands sweep across the peninsula; dangerous rip currents along Atlantic beaches.
